result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael M Davis in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Michael M Davis.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and an offer. Case is in resolution posture. Court adjourns matter for plea/sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael M Davis in court.  Attorney Jason Findling in court on behalf of Connor Romenesko for Michael M Davis.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense request an adjourned status date. No objection from the State. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael M Davis in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael M Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MCSO D. Walton.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael M Davis in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has been re-qualified for SPD representation and Attorney Romenesko will be representing the defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Michael M Davis in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informed the court that since his release his hours have been reduced at work. Case passed.

Defendant Michael M Davis in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel and has not retained counsel. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.A.L. and her family or B.J.M. and his family.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael M Davis in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Michael M Davis in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael M Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
